law.text: The secretary for health and family services may authorize the destruction of such original reports and records as have been properly recorded or summarized in the permanent records of the cabinet or are no longer considered necessary to the proper administration of the cabinet. Such destruction or disposition shall be made only by order of the secretary. Any money received from the disposition of such records shall be deposited to the credit of trust and agency accounts.
law.history: Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 218, effective June 20, 2005. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 426, sec. 184, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 74, Art. VI, sec. 46. -- Created 1950 Ky. Acts ch. 110, sec. 4.
